benchmark_details.name: Supervised Dataset for Job Shop Scheduling Problem (JSSP)
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces the very first supervised 120k dataset specifically designed to train Large Language Models (LLMs) for the Job Shop Scheduling Problem (JSSP), enabling effective LLM training through natural language descriptions of the scheduling problem and solutions.
benchmark_details.data_type: natural language descriptions and solutions of job scheduling problems

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a specialized dataset for training and evaluating large language models in solving the Job Shop Scheduling Problem (JSSP).

data.source: Generated using Google's OR-Tools for random JSSP problems.
data.annotation: Automatically generated using OR-Tools to solve scheduling problems.

methods: Comparative analysis with existing neural approaches
methodology.calculation: Calculated by comparing the makespan of the generated schedules with the optimal makespan identified by the OR-Tools solver.
methodology.interpretation: Lower gaps indicate better performance in scheduling; a gap closer to 0% is desirable.
methodology.baseline_results: Average gap of 8.92% for the proposed model compared to 13.01% for existing methods.
methodology.validation: Used a separate evaluation dataset of random problems distinct from the training data.
